messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1960
messages.msgSnippet: Ren, My heart aches for you. My oldest daughter spent 6 weeks in jail once (for lying to a cop about her boyfriend s REAL name) and it is a painful thing to
messages.messageBody:
Ren,

My heart aches for you.

My oldest daughter spent 6 weeks in jail once (for lying to a cop about her
boyfriend's REAL name) and it is a painful thing to endure. I know how much
it hurts to know someone you love and care about is in a terrible place.
Hopefully the experience will help to bring a good change in his life.

I wish there was some way I could think of something to say that would ease
your pain and make you feel better.

.·:*´¨`*:·..·:*´¨`*:·.
*.* Sharon *.*
*· .·*
`*·-:¦:-*´
³´`*:»§«:*´`³

Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1960


> In a message dated 4/18/02 2:40:13 AM Central Daylight Time,
> Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
> << My half brother is not a nice adult at all. But he was an angelic baby
> and
> toddler, and I still remember very, very fondly being with him and
helping
> him then. I was 19 through early 20's during those years. >>
>
>
> It makes my heart ache when I think of my adopted brother, sitting in jail
as
> I write this, totally a messed up adult. I picture that chubby, frightened
> two year old that came home to a new family. His wide eyes and sweet
little
> cheeks....it makes me so sad.
> Ren
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 1960
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/18/02 2:40:13 AM Central Daylight Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/18/02 2:40:13 AM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< My half brother is not a nice adult at all. But he was an angelic baby
and
toddler, and I still remember very, very fondly being with him and helping
him then. I was 19 through early 20's during those years. >>


It makes my heart ache when I think of my adopted brother, sitting in jail as
I write this, totally a messed up adult. I picture that chubby, frightened
two year old that came home to a new family. His wide eyes and sweet little
cheeks....it makes me so sad.
Ren
